intro: Acer schneiderianum var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent maple, is a deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its distinctive pubescent (hairy) leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and orange in the fall. The plant belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in early spring, followed by winged seeds that aid in its dispersal. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and prefers well-drained, acidic soils.
